intro: Puya araneosa, commonly known as the spider lily, is a striking plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pale yellow to white flowers. The plant produces large, showy inflorescences that resemble spider webs, giving it its common name. Puya araneosa is a perennial plant that thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
